roleset.name: recover from, bounce

example.name: rebound-v: definite/numerical arg3
example.text: Speculation about Coniston has caused the stock to rebound from a low of $ 145 .

example.name: rebound-v: looser definition of start point
example.text: Tokyo stocks rebounded Tuesday from two consecutive daily losses in relatively active dealings .

example.name: rebound-v: with arg2-MNR
example.text: After plummeting 1.8 % at one point during the day , the composite rebounded a little , but finished down 5.52 , at 461.70 .

propbank.arg: After plummeting 1.8 % at one point during the day

example.name: rebound-v: with end point
example.text: Then , it rebounded to finish down only 18.65 points .

example.name: rebound-v: With outside causal agent
example.text: Frank Hsieh is the DPP 's " election king " in rebounding the party 's popularity .

example.name: rebound-n: Example with arg 2 and 3
example.text: a better than 50 % rebound from the 190.58 point loss the industrial average logged Oct. 13

propbank.arg: from the 190.58 point loss the industrial average logged Oct. 13

example.name: rebound-n: Example with arg 1 and 3
example.text: the farm sector 's rebound from the agricultural depression of the early 1980s

propbank.arg: from the agricultural depression of the early 1980s

roleset.note: REBOUND-V NOTES: Comparison to other verbs of motion. No Vncls. (from rebound.01-v)
REBOUND-N NOTES: Roleset based on rebound.01. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from rebound.01-n)
